primary.request: Check status of automatic maintenance fee withdrawal
primary.context: Customer expected an autopay withdrawal that has not yet occurred
primary.detail: The agent spent the entire call verifying details and repeating the request back to the user without providing an answer or sending a link before the user hung up.

steps: Agent identifies caller via phone number lookup
Agent asks for property name and account number
Agent repeats all verified info back to customer in a long confirmation statement
Customer becomes confused or impatient and disconnects

failure.detail: Agent over-verified and excessively summarized instead of providing the status or sending a portal link to check autopay.

actions.detail: Verified name, state, and contract number

insights.summary: The customer called to check why an automatic maintenance fee payment hadn't been processed. The agent successfully verified the account but failed to provide any information, instead repeating the customer's data back until the customer hung up.
insights.verbatim: Supposed to be an automatic withdrawal, but it has not come out yet. Is it going to come out?
insights.coaching: The agent should prioritize answering the customer's question or sending a portal link once verification is complete, rather than reciting a long summary of the contract details which caused the customer to lose patience.
